name: Time of Dragons
description: This is an MMO shooter where you ride dragons armed with missiles and lasers!
minimum_requirements: Betriebssystem: Windows 7 or higher Prozessor: 2Ghz Dual Core Arbeitsspeicher: 2 GB RAM Grafik: 1024 MB Graphics Card DirectX: Version 9.0c Speicherplatz: 4 GB verfügbarer Speicherplatz Zusätzliche Anmerkungen: 1280 x 720 or Higher Resolution

reviews.review_text: As much as this game is a cool idea, it's worthless if you can't work out basic matchmaking. I've been put into 1v2 games, 1v3 games, 2v4 games and, amazingly, 1v5 games. I'm not kidding! I've also played against people five times my level, and most games I play have lopsided teams or AFK players.  Other issues include unusual, slightly broken English and very weird text layouts. They need to standardize the size of their text, because some HUD elements look messy and unprofessional.  A good concept, but not very well executed.
UPDATED REVIEW:  This game is great. Not a lot to choose from as far as abilities and dragons go but its fantastic.  Not a single ad or microtransaction.  Just a good game. Tell your friends.

I would recommend this to anyone. It's similar gameplay to star conflict without the grind. It's totally free to play, you get everything you need within a couple games. The plasma ball is a little OP. Would definitely love to see the player base for this grow, the gameplay is pretty fun, the graphics are nice, the game runs smooth, best f2p I've tried so far.

At the moment it's a simple little arena shooter that's in need of refinement, but even in its really early state it's still pretty fun to fly around and dodge gunfire. It's definitely got a lot of potential.  Also, bonus points for making a Unity game that's an actual game, and not just a knockoff of Cookie Clicker or Slenderman.

Time of Dragons delivers an interesting take on aerial combat. It's free, looks good and offers the ability to jump in and play with minimal time investment. I'd like to see where development takes the game, but right now it's a solid starting point.

I spent a few minutes reading the description for the dragons,then picked the vampire. One mintue later I was dodging lazers and rockets which would have took me out if I didnt duck into the temple. I flew out the other side and bombarded my enemies with plasma shots for the win. Its not too technical,doesn`t have the highest graphics but it will give you some hours of fun. No money store so its not pay to win and its easy to pick up. Cant go wrong with the price either.
As a free game... This has modorate graphics and is an amazing free to play game in my opinion... I would recommend this game for someone who loves dragons and a free game!
Dragons with lasers.   Where have I been my whole entire life?

EDIT: Looks live the developer has added achievements and more dragons.  I didn't play much and I don't plan on playing more. I'm kinda on the fence for this one.  The gameplay is super fun but the lack of content is pretty bad.   There aren't any achievements, all the dragons are easy to get, there is no ranking system, and there are not that many players.  I guess I would recommend if you just want to have fun for an hour or so but don't expect anything more than that.

As of now, it gets boring pretty fast, the gameplay is good, there is just nothing much to do. This game could get really big, it just needs a lot of work.  What this game needs: - More content - More players

For a free, early access game this is looking pretty good so far. I enjoy flying around and defeating other dragons with the use of missiles and plasma cannons. I even went through a phase of playing this game often and in doing so, I noticed I was playing with the same players over and over. Even the leaderboards contain mostly players I have seen and played with before. After playing against some of the same people a few times, it can actually feel like two players have something against each other and begin trying to kill each other more than the other players. As with many games, you can hurt players on your team which can lead to you being betrayed (this normally only happens when there are no enemies and your team seems to get bored easily) or accidentally hit. Of course this problem lies within player attitude and not the game itself. I can say though, that the lack of enemies (or teammates for that matter) seems to be down to the game seemingly having no team balancing which results in a lot of unfair matches.  The flight feels quite nice and fluid for the most part but it can be hard to determine the scale and distance of certain objects in the environment. So when you are flying around and you notice you're coming quite close to something large, you usually try to turn sharply or pull up which is difficult sometimes as the dragon seems to want to almost drift and keep moving forward as opposed to just sharply and swiftly pulling up. Most of the time you end up crashing into said object which makes you more vulnerable to attack.   The turret/weapon system is great. It features a number of weapons and items to help you in battle such as plasma turrets (default weapon/fire type), missiles and a special attack that is performed with the R key if I can remember correctly. Most of the special attacks are short range and have what seems to be a spherical radius. In my opinion, the Ogre's (big green, tank-like dragon) special attack is overpowered, since he can stun you and keep you in one spot then use his vast amount of health and firepower to quickly dispose of you.  Anyway, my next point about the turret and weapons system is that the crosshair seems to take a very long time to catch up with where your dragon is looking which can be annoying when you have a clear shot ready but your crosshair is nowhere to be seen. Earlier I mentioned items. These items include stamina refill, weapon cooldown, mines (that float in the air) and a smoke screen (I may have missed something from the list). These also have a cooldown period but can give you an edge in battle and instantly regenerate upon respawning after death. The mines and smoke screen can be good items to use and can make a great combo as you can drop a mine if you're being followed, then drop the smoke screen which will blind your enemy and lead them to fly into the mine. The smoke screen can also hide you when you're on low health and allow you to escape. Your dragon can be given a speed boost (shift key) which takes stamina rather quickly but (if you have it equipped) you can use your stamina refill to give your dragon a second boost.  I did notice that the models and sounds seem to be based off other games/movies...  The Inara - Ikran (Avatar) (Similar sounds too) The Fury - Toothless (HTTYD/2) (Also similar sounds) The Vampire (mainly it's head) reminds me of creatures from the old game Altered Beast but may just be a coincidence. Tiamat is given the same name as the bat queen from Darksiders (perhaps this dragon was given this name instead of the vampire since it would have looked too close to Tiamat). Again, perhaps it's just coincidence or I'm just looking into it too much.  This game is very team based with nice graphics and a great idea behind it. It's a great game for passing the time and having fun and can actually be quite competitive. When you have balanced teams, it can be very enjoyable. If you enjoy team based, dragon flying, weapon firing action then this game is for you. I recommend trying this game and seeing what you think. I may have written a bunch of bad points (which I seem to find it hard not to with most things) but I do really like this game.  I apologise for this painfully long (not as painful as my overuse of certain words) review but thank you for reading - if you didn't die of old age before getting to the end... This is my first review.

Awesome game but it's way too easy. People don't seem to understand how to play at all. They don't move, they don't hit spacebar to do the 'dodge'. They all use the same crappy cannon instead of rockets or the pulse one. They also clearly don't use the Cooldowns. I can shoot 6 missles at any Dragon within like 3 seconds (enough to kill most); then just wait 20s for recharge and repeat.   Get a fast dragon, use the missles or the pulse charge - and equip TWO cooldown reductions. BAM.
Great game the matches are fun and the controls are easy to get use to and all the dragons are very diffrent in thier own ways. 7.5/10 cant wait for updates lack of weapons and maps.

The game is great in certain aspects. The flying is fun and it is just a blast to glide about as a dragon, zooming through the environment.  the combat feels good and challenging, a real accomplishment when you finally get the hang of it.  the one problem I have with the game is the community. I have nothing against the Russian players like other people in the review section do but because of the language barrier, it's hard to communicate as a team. Plus some of the players are just really ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s, deciding to shoot you down, a member of their team, during a team deathmatch (or whatever its called in this game, sorry I can't remember) just because they are bored or they think it's funny.  all in all, a great game that with work, has serious potential.  I'd probably rate this game 8/10

Holy crap this game is good. It has everything anyone has ever wanted. Dragons and lasors. Not just that but you are given the ability to wreck people that suck at this fun and easy dragon with frickin lasor simulator. WHAT MORE COULD YOU ASK FOR? This is the best video game on earth HOLY CRAP!

this is a good game, bit buggy still and may use some more game modes and team balancing  but this is a freaking game thats a battle field in the sky with mother f**king dragons with lasers on there back!  10/10

I really love this game i can defenatly see this game going somewhere with all its positive revews but there are still things that really bug me the fact that you cant join your friends (you need to join the same lobby by luck wich takes time) and some weapons that are a bit over powered like the plasma ball, it does 300 damage each hit and depending on what dragon you use you can deal a lot of damage with the reduce cooldown ability and the worst part is, you dont need any skill to use it at all, it has a BIG hit box so the plasma is really powerfull (i would say reduce the damage to 200 and reduce the hitbox maby)

TL;DR  8/10 but still a WIP  Time of Dragons is a relatively new flight simulator/team shooter that offers a lot of promise if they could implement these few things:  -More weapons (diversity, such as miniguns and shotgun style weaponry)  -more maps (only two right now but they are stunning)  -a system that lets you join friends in game (having to switch between lobbies until you find your accomplice can be somewhat infuriating)  other than that I think this game is amazing for so early in the development stage and I invite you all to join (It's free! get in before it becomes P2W!)

Great fun but needs lot of work, can be something great if devs stick with it.

I don't typically write reviews on things as I doubt they'll be read, but Time of Dragons is a WICKED way to kill a couple hours mindlessly. You get to fly around as a dragon with guns. ♥♥♥♥ - what more do you need in a game?

I saw this game, and I was like, 'Hah! This'll be funny.' So I play it, fully expecting to not enjoy it, but laugh at how bad it was. Lo and behold, it's now my favorite PC game. What I personally look for in a game is a balance between: 1) Skill: Variety, risk vs. reward, etc. 2) Style: Visuals, room for creative play.  This game perfectly balances the two beautifully.  PS: Toxor is NOT OP. In fact, this game is pretty balanced. I main Fury for his special ability and high speed, and I rarely get killed in game. Toxors, Ogres, and Skats are the easiest for me to kill: Toxor for their lack of in-battle maneuverability, Skats for their low health, and Ogres for their low turning speed.

Not so bad actually. Who wouldn't want to fly dragons and kill other dragons using machine guns, rockets and other powers!? It will eventually get better and many players will start playing this game in the future but why not now? Let the community grow and give some feedback for some changes in the game, I believe they'll definitely bring some amazing changes to it. In the end, I'd just like to mention Pros and Cons about this game. Rest is up to you guys.    Pros: +Easy-to-use controls. +Distinctly designed dragons. +Low system requirements.   Cons: -Weak dragon sound design. -Limited gamplay options

As I see it, this game is at a very early point in developement, as there isn't a ton to do.  There isn't a ton I can say about it; its exactly what it looks like. A shooter with dragons. If you have nothing else better to do, I'd say give it a try.

Pros: 1) You are a dragon 2) There are lasers and missiles 3) There are lasers and missiles mounted on dragons 4) You get to play with your friends Cons: The only 3 things I could think of that could make this game better were: 1) Add more dragons 2) Add offline mode Player vs Bots 3) Training mode where you get to test out all the dragons  This is a great game and I would really recommend it!

You want anything more for free? Didn't think so. It's not polished, it's a little clunky, but this game has heart. The Devs seem pretty responsive to the community which is always a plus. Amazing game! Awesome! Can't stop playing!!

Please note: I do actually plan on fixing and editing this review with playtime and this is more of a first look than a review.  There will be a TL;DR  Now, for what I saw so far.    With a dev team of only 7 people this game is good. It looks like they all put effort into the game, and it's optimized beautifully. That being said, a small team doesn't always make the best games mechanics and graphics wise. When I first started the game I was thrown in a room with a dragon staring me in the face, and a basic UI. To the left is information about your dragon, to the right is the possible dragons you can unlock (with info if you hover over the picture of the dragon), the top (which gives you a barebones settings option, an option to quit, and an option to start the game), and the bottom which is filled with items that you can use in the match    The actual gameplay is solid and the gunplay is easy to get into, however there are only two game modes available as of the time this review is written: TDM or DM. Fairly basic modes whos main goal is to get you to understand the weapons that are mounted on to your dragon... and every other dragon. As far as I can see, there are very little if any diversity in the weapons attached to every dragon. This makes the two game modes a battle of 'Who can shoot first' situation. To combat this they give you a shield you can use to block incoming attacks, but nobody really uses it.   Overall this is what you come to expect from a free game. This is truely free: No cash shop and no DLC. Everything in the game can and has to be acquired in game. So far this is only dragons, but hopefully this changes in the future.   Pros: + Truely free + The flying feels great + It's optimized hardcore  Cons: - The audio sounds royalty free - No diversity in weapons - Graphics aren't the best - No real graphics option  TL;DR  The game is okay but there's not a lot of content.
Game was really fun. Kinda wish there was more than 4v4 tough. with more spawn points. controls are really easy to pick up, dificult to master.
First impressions? Fun! You fly around with awesome dragons with loads of guns and stuff. Give it a try!

A fun little game. It definitely works but isn't really worth the time to play for more than about a half hour. Basically just fly around and hold the mouse button for about 5 minutes then hope you hit something.

Great dragon simulator,  PROS: decent graphics, Neat dragons, Good gameplay and flight, I mean... THEY'RE DRAGONS WITH MACHINE-GUNS ON THEIR BACKS! How could you go wrong?  CONS: Not to many options, and some things are a little wonky.  Good game though.  9.5/10

Theme: Dragons with Scifi-Tech. Gameplay: Pvp, Team PVP and other .... pvp oriented activities. Free to Play: Achieve DNA points to unlock new dragons. (my first day playing. ive unlocked 3 dragons) Classes: none but some dragons have unique attacks, different speed and attributes. Examples of unique attacks ^ : Heal team, blind, AoE bomb, flame, leech, stun...maybe more.  Overall: Simple flying pvp match with Dragons!!!!! and seems to be totally F2P not pay2win.... so far.

This is a early play review  Basically this game looks like a typical dogfighter, however, instead of jets or helicopters you control a dragon. just thinking that a flying manta ray could be classified as a monster, I'm not sure it fits into the 'dragon' catagory.  Each dragon has a different characteristics and special abilities that are indicitive of that species. Blinding the enemy, breathing fire for close range combat, Poison, explosive blast, vampiric leaching of life, stunning, healing yourself and ally etc.  Limited purchasable items are available for the dragons. Items can be won or earned by logging into the game or after the match via the lottery. The items currently include skins or 'DNA Points' for the dragons but not much else. Weapons, dragons, abilities can't be upgraded using points as far as I have seen but I could be wrong.  The arenas are nicely constructed with beautiful detail and they range in size, but aren't very dynamic. ie No destructable content. (The plasma orb that can kill a dragon won't leave a burn mark on the landscape let alone make a pit in the ground or walls)  As for the gameplay, the controls aren't very difficult. Standard w,s,a,d movement with q and e as altitude control.  The shield (triggered by holding the right mouse button) isn't very good as you may try to use it and it doesn't respond right away, or sometimes at all.  It is fun, if you have the patience for a game based on repitition with little depth. I'll suggest a few ideas even though I doubt they will be taken up.  Adding a Campaign Mode would help players understand the backstory and reasons why anyone would strap weapons to a dragon and set it lose.  Adding a system to allow players to spend DNA points on the dragons base abilities such as speed, stamina, health etc would go a long way towards making this a great game.  Setting up the matches to be based on the players level would be a required so nobody can twink the dragon and troll people with lower levels and are just begining ie a level 10 harassing a level 3 just because they can and find it funny. IMO thats why most early players don't return to a game that could be great.
Give it a try! It's free :)

Dragon First/Third person shooter.  Choose your dragon, all with diffrent stats, equip some rockets/lasers and more then head into battle online in Team Death Match or Free for All mode.  Fun game so far~
I think if i was on LSD i would enjoy this bad game

Time of Dragons is a little rough around the edges but its something I see a lot of potential in! Its a third person shooter/ flight game where you fly around as a variety of different dragons getting into aerial dogfights with opposing players. Currently there are eight dragons and two game modes to chose from. Now I myself am pretty sure that in the future we will get more options than we already have, but even if we don't its still a good selection of playable dragons. I recommend anyone interested in a game like what I described above try this out, it has a ways to go but for a free to play game it doesn't have any sort of cash grab yet, so that's real good news!
This game is like ♥♥♥♥kked up!! I TRIED TO CONTROL THIS BUT IT HASEN'T WORKED!

It just feels very clunky right about now, but it looks like an interesting idea for a game. I would wait for the game to be updated a bit before playing it.

Good things about this game from my time playing it:  - Dragons - The music wasn't horrible - I topped the scoreboard in TDM despite not bothering to learn anything about how to play - It's free  Bad things about this game:  - Unity Personal Edition - Looks HORRIBLE, despite the nice store page. - Heat mechanic is horrible - fire for ~3 seconds max, overheat. That's not enough time to secure a kill. - Glaciers are faster paced - Controls feel unresponsive due to flight mechanics - My steam profile now has it listed i've played this game - Unity Personal Edition. Again. Seriously, stop making games on this ♥♥♥♥.

I dont have a lot of time on this game so if you want a review coming from more experience then keep scrolling. This game has promise and is fun for the first few minutes you play it. But after a while its boring and has some issues. '  First of all the shield. The shield should not stop you from firing. When you leave the shield up for a while it eventually goes down. When it does you cannot fire leaving you totally open to get shot. Secondly there isnt a very good warning for when you get shot. Sometimes you seem like you get shot from nothing. There is no visual warning and you still take dammage. Finally you should not take dammage from your shortest hair on your left claw getting grazed by a rock. It knocks like 200 hp off and its very annoying.   If you only have a few minutes in a day to play some games and you want a airborne simple shooter game then this is the game for you. Otherwise i would wait for it to get better. It has alot of promise and i hope for the developers to expand on it
Cons - Small maps - Poorly design stages - Bad flying mechanic - Too little customization - Extremely repetitive  Pros - None

This review updated Dec. 17. It is now possible to get past the loading screen. Make sure to create your dragon before trying to do the AI battle or the team battle. If you see the loading screen for more than a few seconds when clicking the AI battle, something is not right, and waiting is useless. This game is very fun, and very underrated - this seems to be due to some bugs in the past, that seem mostly fixed now. The game is relatively simple, and depends on combat to keep it interesting - perfect for a casual gamer who does not want to wade through huge menus. The dragons have good variability, (I tried two) with a choice of weapons, but not so many that you need a college course to analyse it. The tuitorial is just enough to prepare you. When entering the AI battle, there was a real person instead of AI. He killed me easily about 6 times, chatting, as he did, and encouraging me to chat. He would let me hit him just enough to think I might win, but no... (I am very average). He finally slowed down and let me kill him, and then the game starts giving presents - Ha!...pretty nice. The second AI battle had a bot dragon that was very well programed to hide, dart out, evade, and generally act similar to a real person (challenging). The AI battle landscape is well designed with many places to hide and ambush. Anyway...nothing but fun.
